# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_CommandInterpreter # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class LivePreviewInfo ###* * Stores internal preview-info if the game runs currently in Live-Preview. * * @module gs * @class LivePreviewInfo * @memberof gs ### constructor: -> ###* * Timer ID if a timeout for live-preview was configured to exit the game loop after a certain amount of time. * @property timeout * @type number ### @timeout = null ###* * Indicates if Live-Preview is currently waiting for the next user-action. (Selecting another command, etc.) * @property waiting * @type boolean ### @waiting = no ###* * Counts the amount of executed commands since the last * interpreter-pause(waiting, etc.). If its more than 500, the interpreter will automatically pause for 1 frame to * avoid that Live-Preview freezes the Editor in case of endless loops. * @property executedCommands * @type number ### @executedCommands = 0 gs.LivePreviewInfo = LivePreviewInfo class InterpreterContext @objectCodecBlackList = ["owner"] ###* * Describes an interpreter-context which holds information about * the interpreter's owner and also unique ID used for accessing correct * local variables. * * @module gs * @class InterpreterContext * @memberof gs * @param {number|string} id - A unique ID * @param {Object} owner - The owner of the interpreter ### constructor: (id, owner) -> ###* * A unique numeric or textual ID used for accessing correct local variables. * @property id * @type number|string ### @id = id ###* * The owner of the interpreter (e.g. current scene, etc.). * @property owner * @type Object ### @owner = owner ###* * Sets the context's data. * @param {number|string} id - A unique ID * @param {Object} owner - The owner of the interpreter * @method set ### set: (id, owner) -> @id = id @owner = owner gs.InterpreterContext = InterpreterContext class Component_CommandInterpreter extends gs.Component @objectCodecBlackList = ["object", "command", "onMessageADVWaiting", "onMessageADVDisappear", "onMessageADVFinish"] ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> ###* * A component which allows a game object to process commands like for * scene-objects. For each command a command-function exists. To add * own custom commands to the interpreter just create a sub-class and * override the gs.Component_CommandInterpreter.assignCommand method * and assign the command-function for your custom-command. * * @module gs * @class Component_CommandInterpreter * @extends gs.Component * @memberof gs ### constructor: () -> super() ###* * Wait-Counter in frames. If greater than 0, the interpreter will for that amount of frames before continue. * @property waitCounter * @type number ### @waitCounter = 0 ###* * Index to the next command to execute. * @property pointer * @type number ### @pointer = 0 ###* * Stores states of conditions. * @property conditions * @type number * @protected ### @conditions = [] ###* * Stores states of loops. * @property loops * @type number * @protected ### @loops = [] # FIXME: Should not be stored in the interpreter. @timers = [] ###* * Indicates if the interpreter is currently running. * @property isRunning * @type boolean * @readOnly ### @isRunning = no ###* * Indicates if the interpreter is currently waiting. * @property isWaiting * @type boolean ### @isWaiting = no ###* * Indicates if the interpreter is currently waiting until a message processed by another context like a Common Event * is finished. * FIXME: Conflict handling can be removed maybe. * @property isWaitingForMessage * @type boolean ### @isWaitingForMessage = no ###* * Stores internal preview-info if the game runs currently in Live-Preview. *
    *
  • previewInfo.timeout - Timer ID if a timeout for live-preview was configured to exit the game loop after a certain amount of time.
    • *
  • previewInfo.waiting - Indicates if Live-Preview is currently waiting for the next user-action. (Selecting another command, etc.)
    • *
  • previewInfo.executedCommands - Counts the amount of executed commands since the last * interpreter-pause(waiting, etc.). If its more than 500, the interpreter will automatically pause for 1 frame to * avoid that Live-Preview freezes the Editor in case of endless loops.
    • *
* @property previewInfo * @type boolean * @protected ### @previewInfo = new gs.LivePreviewInfo() ###* * Stores Live-Preview related info passed from the VN Maker editor like the command-index the player clicked on, etc. * @property previewData * @type Object * @protected ### @previewData = null ###* * Indicates if the interpreter automatically repeats execution after the last command was executed. * @property repeat * @type boolean ### @repeat = no ###* * The execution context of the interpreter. * @property context * @type gs.InterpreterContext * @protected ### @context = new gs.InterpreterContext(0, null) ###* * Sub-Interpreter from a Common Event Call. The interpreter will wait until the sub-interpreter is done and set back to * null. * @property subInterpreter * @type gs.Component_CommandInterpreter * @protected ### @subInterpreter = null ###* * Current indent-level of execution * @property indent * @type number * @protected ### @indent = 0 ###* * Stores information about for what the interpreter is currently waiting for like for a ADV message, etc. to * restore probably when loaded from a save-game. * @property waitingFor * @type Object * @protected ### @waitingFor = {} ###* * Stores interpreter related settings like how to handle messages, etc. * @property settings * @type Object * @protected ### @settings = { message: { byId: {}, autoErase: yes, waitAtEnd: yes, backlog: yes }, screen: { pan: new gs.Point(0, 0) } } ###* * Mapping table to quickly get the anchor point for the an inserted anchor-point constant such as * Top-Left(0), Top(1), Top-Right(2) and so on. * @property graphicAnchorPointsByConstant * @type gs.Point[] * @protected ### @graphicAnchorPointsByConstant = [ new gs.Point(0.0, 0.0), new gs.Point(0.5, 0.0), new gs.Point(1.0, 0.0), new gs.Point(1.0, 0.5), new gs.Point(1.0, 1.0), new gs.Point(0.5, 1.0), new gs.Point(0.0, 1.0), new gs.Point(0.0, 0.5), new gs.Point(0.5, 0.5) ] onHotspotClick: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onClick, no, data.bindValue) onHotspotEnter: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onEnter, yes, data.bindValue) onHotspotLeave: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onLeave, no, data.bindValue) onHotspotDragStart: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onDrag, yes, data.bindValue) onHotspotDrag: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onDrag, yes, data.bindValue) onHotspotDragEnd: (e, data) -> @executeAction(data.params.actions.onDrag, no, data.bindValue) onHotspotStateChanged: (e, params) -> if e.sender.behavior.selected @executeAction(params.actions.onSelect, yes) else @executeAction(params.actions.onDeselect, no) ###* * Called when a ADV message finished rendering and is now waiting * for the user/autom-message timer to proceed. * * @method onMessageADVWaiting * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onMessageADVWaiting: (e) -> messageObject = e.sender.object if !@messageSettings().waitAtEnd if e.data.params.waitForCompletion @isWaiting = no messageObject.textRenderer.isWaiting = no messageObject.textRenderer.isRunning = no messageObject.events.off "waiting", e.handler if @messageSettings().backlog and (messageObject.settings.autoErase or messageObject.settings.paragraphSpacing > 0) GameManager.backlog.push({ character: messageObject.character, message: messageObject.behavior.message, choices: [] }) ###* * Called when an ADV message finished fade-out. * * @method onMessageADVDisappear * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onMessageADVDisappear: (messageObject, waitForCompletion) -> SceneManager.scene.currentCharacter = { name: "" } messageObject.behavior.clear() messageObject.visible = no if waitForCompletion @isWaiting = no @waitingFor.messageADV = null ###* * Called when an ADV message finished clear. * * @method onMessageADVClear * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onMessageADVClear: (messageObject, waitForCompletion) -> messageObject = @targetMessage() if @messageSettings().backlog GameManager.backlog.push({ character: messageObject.character, message: messageObject.behavior.message, choices: [] }) @onMessageADVDisappear(messageObject, waitForCompletion) ###* * Called when a hotspot/image-map sends a "jumpTo" event to let the * interpreter jump to the position defined in the event object. * * @method onJumpTo * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onJumpTo: (e) -> @jumpToLabel(e.label) @isWaiting = no ###* * Called when a hotspot/image-map sends a "callCommonEvent" event to let the * interpreter call the common event defined in the event object. * * @method onJumpTo * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onCallCommonEvent: (e) -> @callCommonEvent(e.commonEventId, e.params || [], !e.finish) @isWaiting = e.waiting ? no ###* * Called when a ADV message finishes. * * @method onMessageNVLFinish * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onMessageADVFinish: (e) -> messageObject = e.sender.object if not @messageSettings().waitAtEnd then return GameManager.globalData.messages[lcsm(e.data.params.message)] = { read: yes } GameManager.saveGlobalData() if e.data.params.waitForCompletion @isWaiting = no @waitingFor.messageADV = null pointer = @pointer commands = @object.commands messageObject.events.off "finish", e.handler #messageObject.character = null if messageObject.voice? and GameManager.settings.skipVoiceOnAction AudioManager.stopSound(messageObject.voice.name) if not @isMessageCommand(pointer, commands) and @messageSettings().autoErase @isWaiting = yes @waitingFor.messageADV = e.data.params fading = GameManager.tempSettings.messageFading duration = if GameManager.tempSettings.skip then 0 else fading.duration messageObject.waitForCompletion = e.data.params.waitForCompletion messageObject.animator.disappear(fading.animation, fading.easing, duration, gs.CallBack("onMessageADVDisappear", this, e.data.params.waitForCompletion)) ###* * Called when a common event finished execution. * * @method onCommonEventFinish * @return {Object} Event Object containing additional data. * @protected ### onCommonEventFinish: (e) -> SceneManager.scene.commonEventContainer.removeObject(e.sender.object) e.sender.object.events.off "finish" @subInterpreter = null @isWaiting = no ###* * Called when a scene call finished execution. * * @method onCallSceneFinish * @param {Object} sender - The sender of this event. * @protected ### onCallSceneFinish: (sender) -> @isWaiting = no @subInterpreter = null ###* * Serializes the interpreter into a data-bundle. * * @method toDataBundle * @return {Object} The data-bundle. ### toDataBundle: -> if @isInputDataCommand(Math.max(@pointer - 1, 0), @object.commands) pointer: Math.max(@pointer - 1 , 0), choice: @choice, conditions: @conditions, loops: @loops, labels: @labels, isWaiting: no, isRunning: @isRunning, waitCounter: @waitCounter, waitingFor: @waitingFor, indent: @indent, settings: @settings else pointer: @pointer, choice: @choice, conditions: @conditions, loops: @loops, labels: @labels, isWaiting: @isWaiting, isRunning: @isRunning, waitCounter: @waitCounter, waitingFor: @waitingFor, indent: @indent, settings: @settings ###* # Previews the current scene at the specified pointer. This method is called from the # VN Maker Scene-Editor if live-preview is enabled and the user clicked on a command. # # @method preview ### preview: -> try return if !$PARAMS.preview or !$PARAMS.preview.scene GameManager.tempFields.choices = [] GameManager.setupCursor() @previewData = $PARAMS.preview gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("previewRestart") if @previewInfo.timeout clearTimeout(@previewInfo.timeout) if Graphics.stopped Graphics.stopped = no Graphics.onEachFrame(gs.Main.frameCallback) scene = new vn.Object_Scene() scene.sceneData.uid = @previewData.scene.uid SceneManager.switchTo(scene) catch ex console.warn(ex) ###* # Sets up the interpreter. # # @method setup ### setup: -> @previewData = $PARAMS.preview if @previewData gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseDown", (=> if @previewInfo.waiting if @previewInfo.timeout clearTimeout(@previewInfo.timeout) @previewInfo.waiting = no #@isWaiting = no GameManager.tempSettings.skip = no @previewData = null gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("previewRestart") ), null, @object ###* # Disposes the interpreter. # # @method dispose ### dispose: -> if @previewData gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseDown", @object) super isInstantSkip: -> GameManager.tempSettings.skip and GameManager.tempSettings.skipTime == 0 ###* * Restores the interpreter from a data-bundle * * @method restore * @param {Object} bundle- The data-bundle. ### restore: -> ###* * Gets the game message for novel-mode. * * @method messageObjectNVL * @return {ui.Object_Message} The NVL game message object. ### messageObjectNVL: -> gs.ObjectManager.current.objectById("gameMessageNVL_message") ###* * Gets the game message for adventure-mode. * * @method messageObjectADV * @return {ui.Object_Message} The ADV game message object. ### messageObjectADV: -> gs.ObjectManager.current.objectById("gameMessage_message") ###* * Starts the interpreter * * @method start ### start: -> @conditions = [] @loops = [] @indent = 0 @pointer = 0 @isRunning = yes @isWaiting = no ###* * Stops the interpreter * * @method stop ### stop: -> @isRunning = no ###* * Resumes the interpreter * * @method resume ### resume: -> @isRunning = yes ###* * Updates the interpreter and executes all commands until the next wait is * triggered by a command. So in the case of an endless-loop the method will * never return. * * @method update ### update: -> if @subInterpreter? @subInterpreter.update() return GameManager.variableStore.setupTempVariables(@context) if (not @object.commands? or @pointer >= @object.commands.length) and not @isWaiting if @repeat @start() else if @isRunning @isRunning = no if @onFinish? then @onFinish(this) return if not @isRunning then return if not @object.commands.optimized DataOptimizer.optimizeEventCommands(@object.commands) if @waitCounter > 0 @waitCounter-- @isWaiting = @waitCounter > 0 return if @isWaitingForMessage @isWaiting = yes if not @isProcessingMessageInOtherContext() @isWaiting = no @isWaitingForMessage = no else return if GameManager.inLivePreview while not (@isWaiting or @previewInfo.waiting) and @pointer < @object.commands.length and @isRunning @executeCommand(@pointer) @previewInfo.executedCommands++ if @previewInfo.executedCommands > 500 @previewInfo.executedCommands = 0 @isWaiting = yes @waitCounter = 1 else while not (@isWaiting or @previewInfo.waiting) and @pointer < @object.commands.length and @isRunning @executeCommand(@pointer) if @pointer >= @object.commands.length and not @isWaiting if @repeat @start() else if @isRunning @isRunning = no if @onFinish? then @onFinish(this) ###* * Assigns @commandScript ###* * Executes the command at the specified index and increases the command-pointer. * * @method executeCommand ### executeCommand: (index) -> @command = @object.commands[index] if @previewData if @pointer < @previewData.pointer GameManager.tempSettings.skip = yes GameManager.tempSettings.skipTime = 0 else GameManager.tempSettings.skip = @previewData.settings.animationDisabled GameManager.tempSettings.skipTime = 0 @previewInfo.waiting = yes gs.GlobalEventManager.emit("previewWaiting") if @previewData.settings.animationDisabled or @previewData.settings.animationTime > 0
